translation.en: It's gotta be perfect today. We only have two more chances. Come on!
translation.ko: 오늘은 완벽해야 돼 기회는 두 번뿐이야, 힘내

translation.en: Two, three, four, run, six, seven, eight.
translation.ko: 둘, 셋, 넷 뛰고, 여섯, 일곱, 여덟

translation.en: Two, two, three, four, five, six, seven, and one!
translation.ko: 둘, 둘, 셋, 넷 다섯, 여섯, 일곱, 하나!

translation.en: Where is the straight line? Guide left.
translation.ko: "'핫 초콜릿 호두까기 인형'을 선보였다" 선을 따라가야지, 왼쪽을 봐

translation.en: The person to your left gets there before you. Nope!
translation.ko: 왼쪽에 있는 친구가 더 먼저 오잖니, 아니지

translation.en: She gets here before you, so you got to line up to her.
translation.ko: 얘가 너보다 먼저 오니까 얘한테 맞춰야지

translation.en: Let's do it again. All three groups, come on.
translation.ko: 다시 하자, 세 그룹 다 같이

translation.en: And one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight.
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷 다섯, 여섯, 일곱, 여덟

translation.en: Two, two, three, four, five, six.
translation.ko: 둘, 둘, 셋, 넷, 다섯, 여섯

translation.en: Here we go, one!
Much better. Okay, okay. Are we okay?
translation.ko: "그 후 몇 달간 연습에 돌입한다" 훨씬 낫다, 다들 알겠지?

translation.en: Are y'all gonna remember everything we did? [kids] Yes!
translation.ko: - 오늘 한 거 기억할 거지? - 네!

translation.en: -Because dancers are what? -[kids] The smartest people on the planet.
translation.ko: - 댄서는 뭐다? - 지구에서 가장 똑똑한 사람

translation.en: [Debbie] The most intelligent people in the planet, and we remember everything, right?
translation.ko: 가장 똑똑한 사람이니까 다 기억할 수 있어, 맞지?

translation.en: [kids] Yes. Okay. Go to makeup. I'll see you in a minute.
-[boy] Thank you, Miss Allen. -You're welcome, sweetie.
[sighs] Oh, God.
Okay, what's next?
Anyone else for hair and makeup?
[female crew member] I see why she's ended up using the…
-[Debbie] Come on, everybody here! -[audience cheering]
[female fan] That's Debbie Allen. She's famous!
-[Debbie] Hot Chocolate Nutcracker! -[audience cheers]
-[females fans whoop] -I am Debbie Allen…
-[audience cheering] -…and I'm so ha-- Wow! Ooh!
I am so thrilled and so happy
to welcome you as our very first audience
for the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker this year.
I know some of you still need to learn how to point your toes and your feet,
translation.ko: "캘리포니아주 로스앤젤레스" 여러분 중에 아직 포인을 배우지 않은 사람도 있겠지만

translation.en: but none of that will come
translation.ko: 그보다 중요한 게 조용히 선생님 말을 듣는 거예요

translation.en: if you don't learn how to be quiet and listen!
translation.ko: 그보다 중요한 게 조용히 선생님 말을 듣는 거예요 "데비 앨런 댄스 아카데미"

translation.en: Welcome to the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker audition.
translation.ko: "오디션 공연 12주 전" '핫 초콜릿 호두까기 인형' 오디션에 온 걸 환영해요

translation.en: Um, I'm really happy to see you.
translation.ko: 만나서 정말 반가워요 "데비 앨런 프로듀서, 감독, 안무가"

translation.en: I see a lot of familiar faces. I see some new faces.
translation.ko: "데비 앨런 프로듀서, 감독, 안무가" 낯익은 친구도 보이고 새로운 친구도 보이네요

translation.en: I am looking for young dancers that have life and energy
translation.ko: 난 활기와 기운이 넘치는 어린 댄서들과 일하고 싶어요

translation.en: and want to be on stage, that can become a character,
translation.ko: 무대에 올라서 캐릭터를 연기할 수 있고

translation.en: that can become a doll or a monkey or a fairy.
translation.ko: 인형, 원숭이 요정이 될 수 있어야 하죠

translation.en: So you have to think of yourself not just as a dancer, but as an actor.
translation.ko: 여러분은 춤도 추지만 연기도 해야 돼요

translation.en: There's a lot of opportunity for you to show me where I could use you,
translation.ko: 오늘 여러 기회를 준비했으니까 여러분의 능력을 보여주세요

translation.en: and know that I will do my best to keep you-- keep you where I think you belong.
translation.ko: 선생님도 최선을 다해서 여러분에게 맞는 곳을 찾아줄게요

translation.en: And if you're not ready after the end of today, don't feel bad.
translation.ko: 공연에 참여하지 못한다 해도 속상해하지 말아요

translation.en: Just know that you need to train a little more. Okay?
translation.ko: 조금 더 연습해야 한다는 뜻이니까요, 알았죠?

translation.en: We did so well last year,
and everyone is just waiting for us to come back.
translation.ko: 많은 사람들이 우리 공연을 기다리고 있어요

translation.en: I'd like to introduce our ballet master, Miss Giana Jigarhan.
translation.ko: 발레 마스터를 소개할게요 가이아나 지가르한 선생님이에요

translation.en: -Madame Jigarhan. -[all applauding]
And today, she's gonna put you through some paces.
translation.ko: 오늘 선생님께서 여러분 실력을 확인할 거예요

translation.en: We may teach you two different combinations,
translation.ko: 두 가지 콤비네이션을 배우게 될 거고

translation.en: and then Miss Eartha Robinson is going to give you a jazz.
translation.ko: 어사 로빈슨 선생님은 재즈 댄스를 알려줄 거예요

translation.en: This is Miss McDonald, the director of the Debbie Allen Dance Academy,
and Miss Cathie Nicholas, of course, who's my right hand and left foot. Okay.
translation.ko: 캐시 니컬러스 선생님은 제 오른팔이자 왼발이죠

translation.en: [Giana in Russian accent] So let me-- Call me the names, échappé.
We'll go, one and two and three and four.
One and two.
And two, one and two, and three, and four.
So some people come into the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker
translation.ko: 우리 공연에 참여하는 아이들은 "캐런 맥도널드 아카데미 원장 - 모던댄스"

translation.en: at age four, five, and…
you know, at 12, they're still here.
They go all the way through the dance academy,
and so some people are actually on their seventh Hot Chocolate Nutcracker.
translation.ko: '핫 초콜릿 호두까기 인형'만 7번째 하는 아이들도 있죠

translation.en: And then we have those first-timers.
[Debbie] Hop, hop, hop, hop.
Up, down, pivot.
There's so many people. It was a little overwhelming. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 사람이 너무 많아서 조금 무서웠어요 "에이프릴 왓슨"

translation.en: There's a lot going on.
-This is my seventh time. -This is my sixth.
Eight or nine years. Basically half my life.
And one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight.
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷 다섯, 여섯, 일곱, 여덟

translation.en: Two, three, four, and that's it.
Will, what makes you think you couldn't do that?
I-- I don't know.
I like-- I like teaching kids. They drive me nuts sometimes,
translation.ko: 애들 가르치는 게 좋아요 가끔 돌아버릴 것 같고 "테리 비먼 재즈/컨템퍼러리"

translation.en: and they're monsters most of the time.
translation.ko: 애들이 소악마처럼 굴 때가 많긴 하지만요

translation.en: [Debbie] Careful.
-Are you auditioning? -[instructor] Eight. Can I watch you?
-Okay. -[girl] I just don't want to.
You don't want to?
Well, then sit down. If you're not gonna audition,
translation.ko: 그럼 앉아 있으렴 오디션 보기 싫다고 엄마한테 말해줄게

translation.en: just tell your-- I'll tell your mom, sit down.
[Giana in Russian accent] I love what I'm doing.
And I always wanted teach children.
translation.ko: "마담 가이아나 지가르한 발레 마스터" 늘 애들을 가르치고 싶었어요

translation.en: In a company, dancers already trained, and they know what they doing,
translation.ko: 공연단 댄서들은 배움을 마쳐서 이미 발레에 능숙하지만

translation.en: but children, you opening for them, beauty of ballet
and beauty of art,
and through that experience,
I realized they start appreciate, um, beauty of life too.
translation.ko: 인생의 아름다움도 느끼게 되는 것 같더군요

translation.en: I'm gonna keep my eye on you, and I'll watch you in class.
translation.ko: 선생님이 수업할 때 너희들을 지켜볼 거고

translation.en: If I have an opening, I'll come get you, but now, I think you need to train more.
translation.ko: 자리가 생기면 얘기할 거지만 지금은 연습이 더 필요해

translation.en: You just need more class. You just need more class.
-It hurts my feelings too. -[crying] I love you.
[Debbie] I'm very happy. You all did so great. Thank you very much.
-Say, "Thank you, Miss Allen!" -[kids] Thank you, Miss Allen!
I'll see you tomorrow, one o'clock. Go!
[Debbie] As a young girl, The Nutcracker was so important to me.
translation.ko: 어린 저에게 '호두까기 인형'은 의미 있는 작품이었어요

translation.en: I was in the flower land.
We sang the…
♪ Welcome to flower land ♪
♪ What tidings have you to bring us? ♪
"The Sugar Plum Fairy" was always my dream.
translation.ko: '사탕 요정의 춤'을 추는 걸 항상 꿈꿨죠

translation.en: I love "The Sugar Plum," that music.
[Giana] The original Nutcracker, Tchaikovsky create the music,
translation.ko: 원조 '호두까기 인형'은 차이콥스키가 음악을 작곡했고 "표트르 차이콥스키 - 작곡 마리우스 페티파 - 안무"

translation.en: and, uh, Petipa, French choreographer, he create a libretto for ballet.
translation.ko: "표트르 차이콥스키 - 작곡 마리우스 페티파 - 안무" 프랑스 안무가 페티파가 발레 대본을 만들었죠

translation.en: First, The Nutcracker was performed in, uh, Saint Petersburg,
in the Mariinsky Theatre in 1892.
Critics didn't like that, but public got crazy.
The Nutcracker brand and name is just so familiar to people,
and then our twist is the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker.
translation.ko: "노먼 닉슨 제작 책임자/데비의 남편" 거기에 '핫 초콜릿'을 붙여서 반전을 꾀했어요

translation.en: If you go to see New York City Ballet,
translation.ko: "데비 앨런 작 핫 초콜릿 호두까기 인형" 뉴욕시티 발레단 공연을 가면

translation.en: they have adults performing all the principal parts,
with kids that would just get up and run across the stage, sit on a tree.
translation.ko: 애들은 무대 위를 달리거나 나무 위에 앉아 있죠

translation.en: But our Nutcracker,
although we have professionals and teachers
playing some of the roles,
the kids are the stars.
[Debbie] As a young child, I wanted to be a Black fairy queen flying in the air.
translation.ko: 전 어릴 적에 하늘을 나는 흑인 요정 여왕이 되고 싶었어요

translation.en: I never saw any of that when I was growing up,
but I still knew I wanted to be that.
[Debbie] There had been a couple of different Chocolate Nutcrackers
translation.ko: 그간 전국에서 두 버전의 '초콜릿 호두까기 인형'이

translation.en: all over the country,
but I decided to take it on and make it fun
and have a cultural identity of music that was not tied to Tchaikovsky.
translation.ko: 차이콥스키의 음악과 관련 없는 문화적 정체성을 나타내고 싶었죠

translation.en: [Debbie] So the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker takes us on a journey
translation.ko: 제가 만든 버전에서 여정의 배경이 되는 곳은

translation.en: to real and imagined lands,
all done with different styles of dance and music.
translation.ko: 서로 다른 춤과 음악이 각 배경에 등장하죠

translation.en: In "Flamenco Fire," I am a roach.
-Yeah, we're fairies. We're Egyptians. -"Egypt." [laughs]
We're "Bollywood."
I do "China."
I'm in "Birdland." I'm in the party scene.
Anything with a guy in it, I'm in it basically.
I'm playing the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker, or you can just call me "HC."
translation.ko: 핫 초콜릿 호두까기 인형 줄여서 'HC' 역할을 맡았어요

translation.en: I'm a spider in the rain forest.
[Debbie] In October, we start rehearsing.
Oh, my goodness.
You guys have to do your job.
translation.ko: 주어진 일은 꼭 해야 돼 "캐시 니컬러스 부원장"

translation.en: Your job is to come to rehearsal… prepared.
translation.ko: 너희 일은 준비된 상태로 연습에 오는 거지

translation.en: You also have to be responsible at home too.
Miss Allen doesn't play. You guys have to be role models.
translation.ko: 앨런 선생님은 장난 안 쳐 너희는 롤 모델도 돼야 하고

translation.en: You have to be model citizens at home, at school.
translation.ko: 집과 학교에서 모범적인 생활을 해야 해

translation.en: Is there anybody in here that's three?
No.
-Good. Put your hand down! -[giggles]
[Cathie] Is there anybody in here that's four?
Four years old.
Come here.
Good girl. Come on.
Shh! Quiet!
Are there any five-year-olds?
Come on down.
Shh! Hey!
[whispering] Yes, come on. Spread out. We're gonna be on this line.
translation.ko: 그래, 떨어져서 서볼까? 같은 줄에 설 거야

translation.en: Spread out, face the front.
Are you five for real?
You're tall.
Come on.
[Debbie] You need to practice.
You're not gonna get there,
switching and going around to the mall and being cute in heels.
translation.ko: 하이힐 신고 귀여운 척하며 쇼핑몰 다녀서 되겠니?

translation.en: Take those high heels off and get down on the floor and stretch.
translation.ko: 하이힐 벗고 플로어에 누워서 스트레칭을 해야지

translation.en: [woman] Debbie expects a lot of greatness out of these kids
just on every level, not just one thing, but just everything,
and so, in the world… things are not easy.
translation.ko: "샨텔 히스 힙합" 이 세상에서 산다는 게 쉬운 일은 아니잖아요

translation.en: Even in this dance floor.
When they come across this floor, some will fall,
but if you don't fall at least once a day, you ain't reachin'.
translation.ko: 하루에 한 번 넘어지지 않으면 노력하지 않는 거예요

translation.en: I need a tilt that goes into six o'clock.
Trust me.
That's what they're gonna see when you leave DADA.
translation.ko: 우리 아카데미를 나오면 그런 걸 기대할 거라고

translation.en: They don't love you like I do.
translation.ko: 나처럼 너희를 사랑해 줄 것 같아?

translation.en: I met Debbie when I was 16,
about ten years ago.
So, I did Fame with Debbie.
You've got big dreams.
You want fame?
Well, fame costs,
and right here is where you start paying with sweat.
translation.ko: 바로 이곳에서 너희가 흘릴 땀이 그 대가야

translation.en: She's the same right now. It's absolutely brilliant.
I would never walk into a rehearsal without stretching and doing my tendus
translation.ko: 난 무조건 연습 전에 스트레칭과 탕뒤 연습을 하고

translation.en: and having my legs ready and being ready to go.
translation.ko: 다리를 풀어서 완전히 준비된 상태에서 들어갔어

translation.en: It ain't gonna happen.
You won't get to the next level. I'm trying to help you.
translation.ko: 그래야 발전할 수 있어 내가 도와주려는 거야

translation.en: Okay, if I'm kicking your ass, it's 'cause I care. Okay?
translation.ko: 너희를 아끼기 때문에 혼쭐내는 거야, 알겠니?

translation.en: [woman] My mama?
Tough.
She's tough.
Effervescent, the most talented,
a mother truly to all.
♪ Fame! I'm gonna live… ♪
[Vivian] She's a groundbreaker. I mean, this woman
translation.ko: 그리고 개척자예요 오스카 시상식 안무를 10번이나 짰다는 거 아세요?

translation.en: has choreographed the Oscars ten times.
translation.ko: 오스카 시상식 안무를 10번이나 짰다는 거 아세요?

translation.en: Did I ever think I'd be here on this big lot,
a producer, a director, a star,
a choreographer, a mother?
Absolutely!
[Karen] The pieces that involve more students,
translation.ko: 학생들이 많이 동원되는 곡부터 연습을 시작해요

translation.en: we start with those pieces first, and we only rehearse on the weekends.
translation.ko: 학생들이 많이 동원되는 곡부터 연습을 시작해요 연습은 주말에만 하죠

translation.en: [Debbie] All right, let's go right at the top of "Toyland."
Enjoy coming alive.
Dolls, little dolls.
What scene were you guys in?
-"Toyland." -[Cathie] Come on, now.
And what scene are you guys in now?
-[dancers] Well, everything. -[Cathie] All of them? Yeah, see!
See, "Toyland" is a stepping stone.
Everybody who's everybody comes through "Toyland."
translation.ko: 공연에 참여하는 사람은 누구나 '장난감 왕국'을 거쳐

translation.en: You are in "Toyland."
I've never even seen a regular Nutcracker.
translation.ko: 전 원조 '호두까기 인형'을 본 적도 없어요

translation.en: The only thing I know is Hot Chocolate.
translation.ko: '핫 초콜릿' 버전만 알죠 "카일리 제퍼슨 요정 여왕"

translation.en: And I-- I kind of like that.
Kylie Jefferson.
She's the youngest person that I ever put in the Academy.
I remember we walked into… the Debbie Allen Dance Academy,
translation.ko: 데비 앨런 댄스 아카데미에 처음 들어갔던 때가 생각나요

translation.en: in Culver City at the time,
and there were so many people there.
And when we got to the table, I remember them telling my mom
that I could not audition. They were like, "She is too young."
translation.ko: 제가 너무 어려서 오디션을 볼 수 없다고요

translation.en: She came in in first position, hair pulled back… [inhales]
translation.ko: 준비 자세로 들어왔는데 머리는 동여매고 아주 진지했죠

translation.en: …and just so serious, I'm like, "Oh, yeah."
translation.ko: 준비 자세로 들어왔는데 머리는 동여매고 아주 진지했죠 바로 느낌이 왔어요

translation.en: And Miss Allen said, "Let her audition."
[Debbie] And they all looked at me and said, "Miss Allen, she's too young,"
and I said, "I can change the rules."
Perfect.
Most of my students come from LA,
from various economic backgrounds.
Some of them live in Beverly Hills,
some of them live in Compton,
and those that are the most serious about dance,
they come at least five, maybe six days a week,
translation.ko: 매주 최소 5일에서 6일 정도 오는 것 같아요

translation.en: and they are required to take no less than ten, up--
Some of them take 15 classes a week.
She wanted to have a place where, regardless of what you look like,
if you want to dance, you can come dance,
translation.ko: 춤을 추고 싶으면 올 수 있는 곳이었어요

translation.en: which speaks to why we have a large group of people that are on scholarships here.
translation.ko: 그래서 많은 학생들에게 장학금을 주고 있죠

translation.en: A lot of our kids can't afford to come.
We find a way to… get people into the doors who want to be there.
translation.ko: 의지가 있는 학생들에게 기회를 줄 방법을 찾으려고 하죠

translation.en: [Debbie] We go, we go, we go.

translation.ko: 남은 리허설 동안 입 한번 뻥긋해 봐!

translation.en: You're so disrespectful to all these professionals here
trying to make this show incredible.
I'm trying to do your bows.
This is how it should sound all the time, like this.
translation.ko: 리허설 할 때는 항상 이 정도로 조용해야 돼

translation.en: That's how it should sound, like that.
Miss Allen's nice… to me.
I don't know about all the rest of them 'cause they bad.
She don't know I'm bad. She know I got in trouble once.
translation.ko: 제가 못됐다는 건 모르세요 한 번 사고 친 적은 있어요

translation.en: She didn't yell at me, though, but she like me.
I like Miss Allen. She nice.
[Debbie] When Madame Semenova was teaching me at Houston Ballet,
translation.ko: 휴스턴 발레에서 마담 세메노바에게 배울 때

translation.en: do you think we would talk?
Do you think I would open my mouth to speak when she's talking?
translation.ko: 선생님이 말씀하실 때 입을 열었을 거라고 생각하세요?

translation.en: Oh, my God, she taught with that cane. She would whack you.
That's why I taught with a cane on Fame, in tribute to Madame Tatiana Semenova.
You know, she lived long enough to see me become very successful
translation.ko: 선생님은 돌아가시기 전에 제가 성공하는 모습을 보셨죠

translation.en: on Broadway and television,
and I remember our last lunch together,
Madame opened a bottle of champagne…
and she told me I had to keep the cork
because that was good luck. I still have the cork.
translation.ko: 행운의 부적이라면서 제게 코르크를 건넸어요 아직도 가지고 있죠

translation.en: We sat, and she pulled out the programs she had saved,
programs with my name and other students' names
translation.ko: 그동안 모아둔 프로그램을 보여주시더군요 선생님이 사랑했던 학생들의

translation.en: that she had trained and loved.
translation.ko: 선생님이 사랑했던 학생들의 이름이 적혀 있었죠

translation.en: And as we were drinking the champagne and eating,
she says, "Well, you know, I had to find you-- I had to find you."
I said, "What do you mean?" She says,
"Well, we would not keep the Ford grant if we did not diversify the students.
translation.ko: '다양한 학생들을 안 뒀으면' '포드 재단 보조금을 받을 수 없었을 거야'

translation.en: I needed to find a Black student."
And I sat there, and it kind of took me aback
translation.ko: 그 말을 듣고 놀라서 가만히 앉아 있었어요

translation.en: because I was like…
I thought I was chosen because I was really good,
translation.ko: 제가 잘해서 뽑힌 줄 알고 있었거든요

translation.en: not because I was Black.
But then I thought about it, and I said,
translation.ko: 그런데 다시 생각하니까 이런 생각이 들었죠

translation.en: "I was good."
[Karen] We have two and a half days in the theater
translation.ko: 극장에서는 이틀 반 동안 공연을 준비할 수 있어요

translation.en: to get ready for opening night.
translation.ko: 극장에서는 이틀 반 동안 공연을 준비할 수 있어요 "리돈도 해변 공연예술 센터"

translation.en: [Cathie] Are you on the line? Are you on the line?
Load-in has to happen first, then everybody's trying to get-- wonder,
translation.ko: 먼저 장비를 들여놓고 나면 다들 궁금해해요

translation.en: "When are we getting on stage for tech?"
So Miss Allen brings in the people who fly first,
translation.ko: 앨런 선생님이 먼저 에어리얼 출연진을 연습시키고

translation.en: and then maybe the mice,
and then the smaller groups get to do what they need to do,
and then the masses happen.
Uh, no, no, no, no. Where are you going? No.
Straight line. No, no, no.
-[You can't hear it upstairs-- -[Debbie] We need to figure that out.
translation.ko: - 위층에서 안 들리면… - 알겠어, 방법을 찾자

translation.en: -[Debbie] Unify us. -[cast] Unify us.
-Don't divide us. -Don't divide us.
-Unify us. -Unify us.
-Don't divide us. -Don't divide us.
-Unify us. -Unify us.
-Don't divide us. -Don't divide us.
-May this ring. -May this ring.
-Of our power. -Of our power.
-Of our passion. -Of our passion.
-Of our joy. -Of our joy.
-Of our joy. -Of our joy.
-Remain. -Remain.
-Complete. -Complete.
-Forever. -Forever.
-With Hot Chocolate. -Hot Chocolate.
-Hot Chocolate. -Hot Chocolate.
-Hot Chocolate Nutcracker! -Hot Chocolate Nutcracker!
-Hot Chocolate Nutcracker! -Hot Chocolate Nutcracker!
All right, so April is our Fairy Queen today.
translation.ko: 좋아, 오늘은 에이프릴이 요정 여왕을 할 거야

translation.en: Good luck, April!
And we're welcoming back Prince-- Kris Nobles as our Prince.
translation.ko: 크리스 노바스 왕자 역할로 돌아온 걸 환영해

translation.en: All right, sign up for your theater tickets
translation.ko: 티켓 신청서에 사인하고 공연 준비할 거야

translation.en: and get ready for the show. I'll see you on the stage.
translation.ko: 티켓 신청서에 사인하고 공연 준비할 거야 무대에서 보자

translation.en: [Karen] We start what we call the children's performances.
Whatever theater we're in,
children are invited from everywhere around Los Angeles
to come in and see the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker,
so children get to see the very first performance every year.
translation.ko: 매년 첫 번째 공연은 어린이들이 먼저 보는 거죠

translation.en: [Debbie] Welcome, you all, to the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker.
translation.ko: '핫 초콜릿 호두까기 인형'에 오신 걸 환영합니다!

translation.en: My name is Debbie Allen, and I'm here to…
[Debbie] Thank you.
When you watch the show today, I want you to think about,
translation.ko: 오늘 공연을 보면서 이런 생각을 해봤으면 해요

translation.en: what do you wanna be?
Do you wanna be one of the dancers up here?
Do you wanna be one of the singers?
Do you wanna design the costumes?
Do you wanna do the makeup?
Do you wanna do the lighting?
There are many opportunities.
-Okay? -[audience applauding]
All right, so, I gotta go and get into character.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 전 지금부터 캐릭터에 몰입해야 돼요

translation.en: [in a mousy voice] I gotta go! I gotta go! I gotta go!
I gotta go get-- get my character together.
I'm running. I'll see you later!
[Nicholas] It's Christmas, and everybody's having the big, fun party,
but then Frankie, Kara's brother,
he gets jealous that Kara gets the Nutcracker instead of him.
translation.ko: 호두까기 인형을 선물로 받은 캐라를 질투해요

translation.en: So him and his friends try to steal the Nutcracker from her,
but then the Nutcracker breaks.
So then, she gets sad, then magic happens,
and she's going to all these different places.
[Jalyn] I was just really nervous before I went on,
and my mom was backstage, helping me get ready.
translation.ko: 엄마가 무대 뒤에서 준비를 도와주고 있었는데

translation.en: And she was just telling me, "Whatever happens, you can't change it,
but, as long as you do your best, you know it's gonna be okay."
And that's what helped me get through the show.
What makes me happiest about this place is to watch their faces.
translation.ko: 공연에서 가장 흡족한 순간은 출연진의 표정을 보는 거예요

translation.en: Some of them that have never been in theater before
get standing ovations,
and to watch their faces, it's like… it's unbelievable.
translation.ko: 좋아하는 표정을 보는 건 놀라운 경험이죠

translation.en: [Eartha] You wanna keep growing.
You never feel that you have arrived, or you've made it,
or there's nothing else left.
translation.ko: 더는 이룰 게 없다고 생각하면 안 되죠

translation.en: Always keep growing. Open yourself up to greater possibilities.
translation.ko: 계속 성장하고 더 큰 가능성을 열어둬야 해요

translation.en: This is what they take away with them.
[Karen] The process, from September to December,
it's pretty intense
Those students who participate, I would say, grow tenfold,
translation.ko: 학생들은 공연을 통해 10배는 성장하는 것 같아요

translation.en: in learning their craft,
in becoming a family,
being on stage in front of 1,800 people,
bearing their soul.
Children are not the same once they do the Hot Chocolate Nutcracker.
translation.ko: 아이들은 공연이 끝나면 다른 사람이 되어 있어요

translation.en: They're brand-new.
[Chantel] Some of these kids had no idea that they even want to dance,
translation.ko: 자기가 춤추고 싶다는 걸 몰랐던 아이들도 있지만

translation.en: but when they're introduced to it and fall in love, it's something special.
translation.ko: 공연을 계기로 춤과 사랑에 빠지고 그건 특별한 경험이 되죠

translation.en: And then some of them are off on Broadway, doing things they never thought they could
translation.ko: 어떤 친구들은 브로드웨이에 가서 상상도 못 했던 일을 하기도 해요

translation.en: and I think that's what the arts does for people.
It can take you wherever you want to be in the world.
translation.ko: 내가 원하는 곳이 있다면 어디든 데려다주죠

translation.en: [Vivian] As a dancer, it takes discipline and determination
and the willingness to continue,
no matter how many times you fall down.
Because success is one step beyond failure.
translation.ko: 실패에서 한 발 더 나아가면 성공이 있기 때문이죠

translation.en: [Savoy] My dream, dream, dream school is USC.
translation.ko: 제가 가고 싶은 학교는 서던캘리포니아 대학교예요

translation.en: My audition is in, like, a couple weeks,
so I'm freaking out a little bit, but, like,
it's cool-- I got a new leotard for it. My mom bought me a new leotard. [laughs]
[JoAnn] One day, I had a long talk with my friend, and she told me, like, "You need to teach."
translation.ko: 하루는 친구가 저한테 가르침에 재능이 있다고 했어요

translation.en: I'm like, "Really? I didn't know." She's like, "Yeah, that's your thing."
I taught my first class, and it was like,
translation.ko: 그래서 한 번 수업을 맡고 나서

translation.en: "Wow, like, I do like to teach. Maybe I should continue doing this."
translation.ko: 좋아한다는 걸 깨달았어요 이쪽으로 나갈까 생각했죠

translation.en: [Chantel] The kids forget sometimes when we're teaching them…
translation.ko: 아이들이 선생님에 대해 깜빡하는 게 있어요

translation.en: They think that, "Oh, they must be old," and, "Oh, they don't do this anymore."
translation.ko: 우리가 이제 은퇴했거나 가르치기만 한다고 생각하는데

translation.en: They don't get to see the-- the-- the professional side of what we still do.
translation.ko: 프로 댄서로 활동하는 모습을 볼 기회가 없어서 그러죠

translation.en: So here I am, the teacher one day,
but in that audition, with some of these major artists,
on tours,
I'm right there in the same playing field as some of my students.
translation.ko: 제가 가르친 학생들과 똑같은 물에서 놀고 있어요

translation.en: It's good. It's healthy competition.
[Giana] Some surprises happen during the teaching years.
translation.ko: 가르치다 보면 놀라운 일을 겪기도 해요

translation.en: Some student that doesn't look very promising,
through the hard work and open mind,
will jump up.
If I ever make my own dance studio, I want it to be, like,
translation.ko: 제가 나중에 댄스 스튜디오를 차리게 된다면

translation.en: a dance studio where you can come and pay how much you're able to pay.
translation.ko: 제가 나중에 댄스 스튜디오를 차리게 된다면 돈을 낼 수 있는 만큼만 내는 곳을 만들고 싶어요

translation.en: There's a lot of good dancers out there, and they just-- they're not in dance class
translation.ko: 어떤 댄서들은 춤은 잘 추는데 돈이 많지 않아서

translation.en: 'cause they don't have enough money.
[Savion] They can take this information and go on and be better dancers.
translation.ko: 여기서 배운 걸 가지고 더 나은 댄서가 될 수 있고

translation.en: They can take this information and go on to be better humans, humanitarians.
translation.ko: 더 나은 사람이 되거나 타인을 챙기게 될 수도 있어요

translation.en: It's the learning. It's the teaching. It's how they receive it.
translation.ko: 배움과 가르침, 그것을 어떻게 받아들이는지가 중요해요

translation.en: I want them to just walk out different.
[Lauren] I love the way…
it felt to become music.
If you could physically think of what it feels like to be music,
translation.ko: 음악이 되는 게 어떤 기분인지 직접 느낄 수 있어요

translation.en: to physically become music,
that's what it's like dancing.
Like… to become the note or the instrument or the beat.
translation.ko: 음이 되고, 악기가 되고 비트가 되는 거예요

translation.en: -That's what it's like to dance. -[applauding in distance]
[Kylie] By the end of my recovery period,
Miss Allen called to ask if I wanted to do the Fairy Queen part.
translation.ko: 앨런 선생님한테 연락이 왔는데 제게 요정 여왕 역을 제안하셨어요

translation.en: And I was scared. I was so scared because I knew that Miss Allen called,
translation.ko: 겁이 났어요 선생님이 연락하는 것 자체가 무서운 일이죠

translation.en: that means I am gonna have to get back to the real work.
translation.ko: 그 말은 고된 훈련이 기다리고 있다는 뜻이거든요

translation.en: It was hard, but doing Fairy Queen made me wanna dance again.
translation.ko: 힘들었지만 요정 여왕을 하면서 다시 춤추고 싶어졌어요

translation.en: Like, I got that… like, that fight back.
I don't know how. I don´t, like, know what made it, but maybe because I had to overcome myself.
translation.ko: 정확한 이유는 모르겠어요 제 나약함을 극복한 걸까요?

translation.en: [April] I think the biggest sacrifice is… time.
translation.ko: 가장 많이 희생하는 게 시간인 것 같아요

translation.en: You spend so much time training and training and training.
You sometimes just have to sacrifice
the regular middle-school, high-school life
translation.ko: 중학교 시절과 고등학교 시절을 보내고 나면

translation.en: so when you're 20-something,
you're phenomenal.
[Karen] There's something about dance…
When you know you're leaving your first dancing school,
and you're getting ready to go out into the world,

translation.ko: 더는 머릿속에만 존재하지 않고 몸짓에서 나타나고 말할 때도 나타나고

translation.en: It's in the way you talk. It's in the way you walk.
translation.ko: 몸짓에서 나타나고 말할 때도 나타나고 걸음걸이에서도 나와요

translation.en: That's when you become a dancer.
When the essence of what it is and the essence of who you are
come together as one,
that's when you become an artist.
This is a lifelong proposition.
It's a marriage.
It is, and it's one that I want to see…
have a continuation.
So that even past my prime or ability to do what I do,
translation.ko: 제 한창때가 지나서 가르치지 못하는 때가 와도

translation.en: it will keep going.
'Cause I'm always gonna be one of those kids.
I don't care if I'm 90.
I'm always, in my heart, one of those kids looking for that opportunity,
translation.ko: 속으로는 기회를 얻고 싶어 하는 어린아이일 거고

translation.en: looking for who's gonna train me,
translation.ko: 날 가르쳐줄 사람을 찾고 답을 구하겠죠

translation.en: how am I gonna get to be who I really know I could be?
translation.ko: '내가 꿈꾸는 미래의 모습은 어떻게 이뤄야 할까?'

translation.en: Where's my opportunity?
I'm always gonna be one of those kids in my heart.
translation.ko: 그런 마음을 품은 어린아이로 살아갈 거예요

translation.en: So listen to me. Front line, you're the first ones out.
translation.ko: 선생님 말 잘 들어 첫 줄이 가장 먼저 나가니까

translation.en: If you're not perfect, everything else is a disaster.
translation.ko: 첫 줄이 완벽하지 않으면 끔찍한 일이 생기는 거야

translation.en: You have to be what? Perfect.
[female singer] ♪ Underneath the Christmas tree ♪
♪ All I want for Christmas… ♪

translation.ko: 둘, 둘, 셋, 넷, 다섯, 여섯, 일곱

translation.ko: 로열 발레단에 들어가서 춤추는 게 제 꿈이에요

One, two, three, four, five!
Go!
I wanna go to Stanford and double major in kinesiology and dance.

translation.en: Ooh, look at you! [laughs]
[Debbie] Two, three, four, five, go.
[Cathie] One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight.
translation.ko: 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷 다섯, 여섯, 일곱, 여덟

translation.en: [female student 1] Hopefully, I'll become somebody

translation.ko: 세상을 바꾸는 사람이 되고 싶어요 세상이 바뀌기를 원하거든요

translation.en: I wanna be, like, a well-known dancer.
